'Spring' (1969) directed by Arvo Kruusement [http://books.google.com/books-
?q=%22Spring+(+1969)+by+Arvo+Kruusement+%22&btnG=Search+Books International Film
Guide 1981 - Page 371] is a film adaptation of Oskar Luts' popular novel
of the same name. [http://books.google.com/books?id=eiIpe99dL5MC&pg=PA318&d-
q=%22kevade%22&ei=BC68SJLYFpTyiwG3nYn0Bw&sig=ACfU3U1MVuGo_6uuKh6ZJks7YzOk1Y5QuA
Eastern Europe By Tom Masters] ISBN 978-1-74104-476-8 The movie placed
first place in the Estonian feature films Top Ten Poll in 2002 held by Estonian
film critics and journalists. [http://tallinnfilm.ee/index.php?page=67&
tallinnfilm.ee] In 1970 the movie sold 558,000 tickets in Estonia (Total
population 1.34 million) [http://www.stat.ee/main-indicators 2008
census] and 8,100,000 in the Soviet Union in
1971. [http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0064542/business Kevade business
@IMDB] The film was re-released in Estonia on 13 April 2006.

The film was shot in Palamuse, which was the prototype area of Oskar Luts'
"Paunvere".
